javanews.gui
Class Client

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      javanews.gui.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class Client
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This class is responsible for the general working environment of the JavaNews application. Processing of messages from the PSEs is not performed here but in the COMPortClient class. This class is used to manage instances of the COMPortClient class and handle the threads contained within them.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Client

public Client(SplashScreen ssSplash)
Initiates the application and internal logger. Requires the current splash screen to be passed as an argument so that updates can be made.

Parameters:
ssSplash - The splash screen being used to provide feedback to the user during the application load
Method Detail

buildMenu

private void buildMenu()
Part of the main constructor. This method is responsible for initialising the menu along with its associated events.

buildGUI

private void buildGUI()
Part of the constructor, it builds and places the core components of the GUI on-screen.

startApp

private void startApp()
First of all the method checks whether the database can be connected to. If it cannot then the user is warned and no windows opened to monitor COM ports. Otherwise it looks through the application preferences for details of COM ports to monitor and then starts threads accordingly.

See Also:
addPort(java.lang.String, int, int, java.lang.String, float)

addPort

private void addPort(java.lang.String comPortName,
                     int baudRate,
                     int dataBits,
                     java.lang.String parityType,
                     float stopBits)
Requests that the COMPortThreadManager add a new thread, and so add another window to the desktop, with the specified settings.

Parameters:
comPortName - The identifier of the COM port to monitor
baudRate - The baud rate of the COM port
dataBits - The length of the data to be received in bits
parityType - The type of parity to be used for error checking
stopBits - The length of the stop bits to be used
See Also:
COMPortThreadManager

getJNWindow

public static Client getJNWindow()
Used for other classes to obtain a copy of the current JavaNews MDI parent application window

Returns:
The main JavaNews window that is being displayed.
